help 2018-10-22 11:47:55 What type? Pitch? Yaw? Roll?
help 2018-10-22 11:48:43 Pitch is up and down, yaw is left and right, roll is, obviously roll, clockwise or counterclockwise
help 2018-10-22 11:50:01 If you want something to maneuver quickly, you want control surfaces, and/or thrust as far from the center of mass as possible in your direction
help 2018-10-22 11:50:19 Aka: A "brute force" strategy is more effective further from the center of mass (yellow orb)
plane-crazy 2018-10-22 11:58:50 Just look at <#501034677793193994> and scale up from there
help 2018-10-22 12:24:06 If you're struggling to take off, you need the center of lift (blue orb) closer to the center of mass (yellow orb)
help 2018-10-22 12:24:32 If it's too far forwards, you'll pitch upwards and only upwards, if it's too far back, your craft will want to smash into the floor
help 2018-10-22 12:24:40 Well this is Roblox, you don't need structural integrity for most things

plane-crazy 2018-11-01 17:09:49 But anyways, one trick is to have a huge amount of internal and hidden area, that way they have to guess what you did to make it work, and they REALLY don't like guessing, since, well, it's guessing
plane-crazy 2018-11-01 17:15:56 Think of it this way: Every single part they can see, they can copy, they can paint a rock to look like a pocket watch, but without all the internal cogs, mechanisms, etc, it won't keep track of time
plane-crazy 2018-11-01 17:17:15 Shooting doesn't damage in build mode, and even then, they'd have to remove the entire outer hull without removing any of the internal mechanisms to even have a hope of copying

help 2018-11-04 20:21:55 From <#491710474786832394> about magnets, attract and repel pull and push respectively, when you hold down the key, they do what their name states
Toggle means that instead of holding down the key, you only need push it once and it'll turn on
Strength is how forcefully the magnets push or pull
Range means how far they affect blocks
Loose blocks means anything they're not attached to, when they're on, they only affect blocks they're not attached to, when they're off, they affect every block ON YOUR CREATION

help 2018-11-21 06:25:50 So no 20 block planes, we're talking ones that can fly fast, maneuver on a dime, take a hit, and deliver a serious punch
help 2018-11-21 06:26:10 If you build one well, it'll fall under all those categories on it's own
help 2018-11-21 06:28:05 My original MK 2 fighter was quoted to be like a eurofighter
help 2018-11-21 06:28:27 Only thing it couldn't do was take a hit, specifically on the spinal section of the craft, considering there's only the structure blocks there
help 2018-11-21 06:28:51 The MK 3 solves this by adding a layer of armor along the spine, and re-structuring the wings for a more stable flight

creations-chat 2018-11-22 04:56:52 Xero, what's the issue with it? Or does it actually work?
creations-chat 2018-11-22 04:57:38 Plumits how so? Nosedives, or?
creations-chat 2018-11-22 04:58:18 Ah, center of lift too far forwards, thrust too far down
creations-chat 2018-11-22 04:58:59 Think of applying a force to a see-saw
creations-chat 2018-11-22 04:59:40 Ignore every other force and cut it down the middle, then think of how applying the force would work
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:01:07 It'll make it worse
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:01:16 If you pull back too fast, it'll make it worse
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:01:26 Instead add thrust up-top and drag the center of lift slightly further back
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:02:05 This is a very, VERY stable creation, take a guess why
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:02:46 The center of lift is blue, center of mass is yellow
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:03:32 Actually, that's false Xero
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:03:46 I'll give you a hint, this is an older version, with jets instead of rockets
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:04:22 Er, not quite
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:04:29 The reason it's so stable is because there's jets on the underside
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:04:35 These jets cause it to rotate upwards slightly
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:04:44 Which is countered by the downwards rotation due to the center of lift
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:05:14 Yes, the center of lift is in the back, which causes this craft to pitch downwards at low thrust, but at high thrust, the thrusters on the underbelly counteract this downwards pitch
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:05:42 You probably have too much underbelly thrust and too much upwards pitch Xero
creations-chat 2018-11-22 05:06:07 Either drag the center of lift farther back by adding more wings in the back, or add thrusters on the top, so as they activate, they cause it to pitch downwards

help 2018-11-24 18:56:25 Pitch, yaw, or roll?
help 2018-11-24 18:57:29 Pitch, dedicate the interior control surfaces to up and down, 
Roll, dedicate the outer-most control surfaces to tilt in an alternating pattern
Yaw, get a better tail with more control surfaces on it
With pure control surfaces, your turning increases the faster you go

help 2018-12-20 22:58:58 Disabling it means your colors will default to Roblox's standards, but it will also use alot less save data

help 2018-12-28 21:48:38 First of all, set them to auto controls and see which directions they go
You want them to be as far away from the center of mass as possible, with their respective movement, so you want pitch panels near the front and back, yaw near the top and bottom, and roll near the wing tips
help 2018-12-28 21:49:22 Demonstrating with my Wyvern fighter, the control panels near the edge of the wings are roll, while the ones near the front are for pitch, the tail (which you can't see), is entirely dedicated to yaw
help 2018-12-28 21:52:53 Control panels also work better at higher speeds
help 2018-12-28 21:58:27 It actually doesn't
help 2018-12-28 21:58:51 Only wing panels mimic any sort of aerodynamics, and even then it's moreso a "go fast, create upwards force" thing
help 2018-12-28 22:00:05 The slightest amount of imbalancing will make it start tilting, and engines near the back (or bottom in this case), make it more susceptible to instabilities
help 2018-12-28 22:00:12 ... <@!476231567971188736> , no, that won't work
help 2018-12-28 22:00:27 This isn't Kerbal Space Program, blocks aren't affected by aerodynamics
help 2018-12-28 22:01:04 It's literally the imbalance on your central seat that's amplified by the vulnerability to instability
plane-crazy 2018-12-28 22:01:21 For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction
plane-crazy 2018-12-28 22:01:24 That's the most help you're getting
help 2018-12-28 22:01:47 ... <@!476231567971188736> , this is a **GAME**
help 2018-12-28 22:02:19 It's not a real life physics simulation, if you want that, the closest thing you're probably going to get is KSP
help 2018-12-28 22:03:27 You get the point, the only objects that are affected by aerodynamics are wings, and even then they only cause drag and lift when moving sufficiently fast enough

help 2019-01-26 03:03:59 Control panels, you've set them to automatic haven't you?
help 2019-01-26 03:04:42 What you're likely lacking is pitch, control panels will automatically roll you and start both yawing and pitching with the movement of the mouse
help 2019-01-26 03:05:06 However, if you want the best performance, although it is far less precise and doesn't auto-stabilize, I'd suggest using keyboard controls
help 2019-01-26 03:05:40 If you want automatic however, add control surfaces to the front and back, that'll give you more pitch, add more to the edges of your current wing to get roll, and add some vertical ones to the front or back to get yaw
help 2019-01-26 03:06:13 For reference
Pitch: Up/down
Yaw: Left/right
Roll: Clockwise/counter
help 2019-01-26 03:07:04 Not a problem, if you don't mind complex controls, manual keybinds are your best friend, as they add far more precision
help 2019-01-26 03:08:11 While with automatic controls, control surfaces will only go halfway on roll or pitch to satisfy their needs, manual keybinds will allow you to dedicate them entirely to either roll, pitch or yaw
help 2019-01-26 03:08:38 And since the further away from their respective plane, they're at, the better, doing so will let you do crazy maneuvers
help 2019-01-26 03:09:05 They also allow you to add engines to assist your turns, which can lead to even further maneuvers, to the point of absurdity sometimes
plane-crazy 2019-01-26 03:10:56 When you take damage VIA guns, blocks become more transparent, take a guess what happened
plane-crazy 2019-01-26 03:11:11 In a way
help 2019-01-26 03:13:07 Manual or auto controls?
help 2019-01-26 03:13:47 Add more control surfaces to the left, right, top or bottom side of the center of mass
help 2019-01-26 03:13:53 As far away as you can infact
help 2019-01-26 03:14:06 Just read what I typed to Jelly and convert it with roll in mind instead of pitch
help 2019-01-26 03:14:35 Are they outer-most or inner-most?
help 2019-01-26 03:15:28 You likely need more, or assist thrusters

Or: T/F/F = T, T/F/T = T, F/F/F = F

help 2019-05-27 23:15:20 <@!208764105681666049> , Think of every action like levers, the further away from the center they are, the more force is applied
help 2019-05-27 23:15:43 Technically less speed yes, but considering how much air resistance those wings put up, more force basically equals more speed
help 2019-05-27 23:16:07 Having the affecting surfaces farther from the center of mass will help
help 2019-05-27 23:16:36 Hence why if you need to dedicate one axis to things, you dedicate pitch to the front and back-most wings, roll to the edges of the main wings, and yaw (obviously) to the tail
